  • Serie

Class Serie<T>

T is either an Array, or a TypedArray (Float32Array etc...) supported by an ArrayBuffer or SharedArrayBuffer

Type parameters

  • T: IArray

Hierarchy

  • Serie

Index

Constructors

  • constructor

Properties

  • array
  • itemSize
  • shared
  • userData

  • count
  • isArray

Constructors

Private constructor

  • new Serie<T>(array: T, itemSize: number, shared: boolean, userData?: {}): Serie<T>

  • Type parameters

    • T: IArray

    Parameters

    • array: T
    • itemSize: number
    • shared: boolean
    • userData: {} = {}
      • [key: string]: any

    Returns Serie<T>

Properties

Readonly array

array: T

The underlying array of the serie

Readonly itemSize

itemSize: number

The itemSize is the dimension of one 'cell' of the serie

Readonly shared

shared: boolean

Whether or not array is a SharedArrayBuffer

userData

userData: {} = {}

Mutable dictionary to store consumer data (context information of the usage)

Type declaration

  • [key: string]: any

Accessors

count

  • get count(): number

  • Get the number of items (an item being of size [[itemCount]])

    Returns number

isArray

  • get isArray(): boolean

  • Returns boolean

isArrayBuffer

  • get isArrayBuffer(): boolean

  • Returns boolean

length

  • get length(): number

  • Get the size of this serie, i.e., being count * itemSize

    Returns number

Methods

at

  • at(i: number): number

  • Parameters

    • i: number

    Returns number

clone

  • clone(resetValues?: boolean): Serie<IArray>

  • Return a new serie similar to this (same type of array and buffer), and with the same values in the array.

    Parameters

    • resetValues: boolean = false

      True if reset the values to 0, false otherwise (default)

    Returns Serie<IArray>

forEach

  • forEach(callback: Function): void

  • Iterate over all items

    Parameters

    • callback: Function

      The callback that will called for each item

    Returns void

image

  • image(count: number, itemSize: number): Serie<IArray>

  • Return a new serie similar to this (same type of array and buffer), but with different count and itemSize. All values are initialized to 0.

    see

    createEmptySerie

    Parameters

    • count: number

      The number of items

    • itemSize: number

      The size of the items

    Returns Serie<IArray>

itemAt

  • itemAt(i: number): number | any[]

  • Parameters

    • i: number

    Returns number | any[]

map

  • map(callback: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • Map the items

    Parameters

    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Static create

  • create<T>(__namedParameters: { array: T; itemSize: number; userData?: {} }): Serie<T>

  • Type parameters

    • T: IArray

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { array: T; itemSize: number; userData?: {} }
      • array: T

        The array of values. Can be either an instance of Array or a TypedArray. For TypeArray, the underlaying buffer can be either of type ArrayBuffer or SharedArrayBuffer

      • itemSize: number

        The size of each item. count will be array.length / itemSize

      • Optional userData?: {}

        user data

        • [key: string]: any

    Returns Serie<T>
